newsitem.title: USA: EQIP rule likely to be unveiled Friday-USDA.
newsitem.headline: EQIP rule likely to be unveiled Friday-USDA.

text.p: Rules for the new $1.3 billion Environmental Quality Incentive Program are likely to be unveiled on Friday, Deputy U.S. Agriculture Secretary Richard Rominger said.

The seven-year program, created as part of the 1996 farm policy law, would provide cost-share money and expert advice to crop and livestock farmers who want to make environmental and conservation improvements. Half the money would go to livestock farmers.
Rominger told a panel discussion Thursday the rules were "scheduled to be published tomorrow" in the Federal Register.
The rules already were on display at the Government Printing Office, Rominger said -- a sign of imminent publication.
Two other USDA officials indicated the rules would be announced Friday.
